title: Vigil held for teen shot dead near Canal Winchester, 18-year-old suspect arrested
content:
FRANKLIN COUNTY, OH (WCMH) — Hundreds of loved ones showed their support for a 16-year-old boy who was shot and killed on Friday.
Damieon Testfi was killed on Oak Bend Bouelvard, where family and friends gathered to celebrate the life of the Franklin County teen.
“It hurts so bad, like a pain that will never go away,” said Marie Boucicaut, Damieon’s mother.
Columbus police found Testfi suffering a gunshot wound after reports of a shooting in the area. He was pronounced dead at the scene.
Boucicaut said she will not rest until there is justice.
Police arrested Elijah Morgan Sunday morning and charged him with the shooting death of Tesfai. Morgan, 18, was arrested at a secondary location on Homestead Drive.
Anyone with information on this shooting can call the Columbus Police Homicide Unit at 614-645-4730 or Crime Stoppers at 614-461-8477.
